discussion.content:
Definately B and C. 
You can also define the security role for the Business Process Flow (BPF). Users who have those security roles will have access to the BPF and who do not have those security roles will not be able to work with the BPF.

If a user does not have access to the current process that is applied to a record, options will be disabled.

You must also set the order that defines in which BPFs are viewed.
B and C are correct answer
